A **python**, S, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a type of non-[poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison") [snake](/wiki/Snake_\(monster_class\) "Snake (monster class)") that has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and it can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim") like other snakes, but will not [hide](/wiki/Hide "Hide") under objects.

A python has a bite attack, a touch attack, a [holding attack](/wiki/Holding_attack "Holding attack") that doubles as a [drowning attack](/wiki/Drowning_attack "Drowning attack"), and a second holding attack.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Message](#Message)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated pythons are always created hostile.

Pythons generate among the random S that are part of the first quest [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") and make up 24⁄35 of the monsters that randomly generate on the [Archeologist quest](/wiki/Archeologist_quest "Archeologist quest").

Pythons generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under, despite lacking the ability to hide.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

Pythons are rarely remarkable or dangerous in most contexts: at 3 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") they are far slower than player characters and other snakes, and though they can immobilize a character, their attacks do not deal significant damage. However, their holding attack can drown characters near water, making them a source of [YASD](/wiki/YASD "YASD") for the unsuspecting. Unlike [giant eels](/wiki/Giant_eels "Giant eels") and other [sea monsters](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") with drowning attacks, pythons are not found near water any more frequently than other monsters, making it easy to forget - pythons also use a different message for their holding attack than other drowning monsters.

Be especially wary of pythons while crossing the waters of Medusa's Island - setting a [MSGTYPE](/wiki/MSGTYPE "MSGTYPE") rule for the python's message in your options can be a helpful reminder. [Greased](/wiki/Greased "Greased") armor or an [oilskin cloak](/wiki/Oilskin_cloak "Oilskin cloak") can also protect from their holding attacks.

## History

The python first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Pythonidae](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pythonidae "wikipedia:Pythonidae")***

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Python (genus)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Python_\(genus\) "wikipedia:Python (genus)")***

*Pythonidae*, commonly known as pythons, are a family of nonvenomous snakes found in Africa, Asia, and Australia that contains some of the largest snakes in the world - ten genera and 39 species are currently recognized, including the genus *Python* (or "true pythons"). Pythons are non-venomous snakes that hunt via ambush predation and constrict their prey to suffocate it prior to consumption: they will typically strike at and bite their prey of choice to gain hold of it, then use their physical strength to coil their muscular bodies around the prey animal, effectively suffocating it and causing cardiac arrest before swallowing it whole. Collectively, the pythons are among the most well-documented-and-studied constrictor snakes, much like other non-venomous snakes such as the boas.

Pythons are oviparous, laying eggs that females incubate until they hatch. While many species are available in the exotic pet trade, caution is needed with larger species due to potential danger. Pythons are poached for their meat and skin, leading to a billion-dollar global trade, and can also carry diseases such as salmonella. They are used in African traditional medicine to treat ailments like rheumatism and mental illnesses, and their body parts, including blood and organs, are believed to have various healing properties. In some African cultures, pythons have significant roles in folklore and mythology, often symbolizing strength or a sacred status.

## Message

- \<The python> grabs you!

  A python hit you with its holding attack; their first holding attack can drown you.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, pythons [hit as +1 weapons](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon").

Pythons can be generated in [real zoos](/wiki/Real_zoo "Real zoo"), and will not randomly generate in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). The Snake Pit of the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") may contain pythons among the random 2-4 S generated at level creation.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), 1⁄5 of the monsters randomly generated on the Water Temple level of the [Chaos Temple Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Temple_Quest "Chaos Temple Quest") will be pythons.

Four pythons appear within one of the rooms in [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon")'s lair containing the [statue trap](/wiki/Statue_trap "Statue trap") of [Shaktari](/wiki/Shaktari "Shaktari") if his dwelling appears as [the third Abyss level](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine_Flats#Demogorgon.27s_palace "User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine Flats").

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for snake](/wiki/Snake#Encyclopedia_entry "Snake").*

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1243](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1243): *snakes get a free house*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

S python
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Bite 1d4, Touch, Hug 1d4 drowning, Hug 2d4

Base level 6
Base experience 82
Speed 3
Base AC 5
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 250
Nutritional value 100
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A python:

  • can swim.
  • cannot pick up items.
  • has no limbs.
  • is an animal.
  • has a serpent body.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • has infravision.
Reference monst.c#line1768

A python, S, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a type of non-poisonous snake that has infravision, and it can swim like other snakes, but will not hide under objects.

A python has a bite attack, a touch attack, a holding attack that doubles as a drowning attack, and a second holding attack.

Generation

Randomly generated pythons are always created hostile.

Pythons generate among the random S that are part of the first quest monster class for Archeologists and make up 24⁄35 of the monsters that randomly generate on the Archeologist quest.

Pythons generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under, despite lacking the ability to hide.[1]

Strategy

Pythons are rarely remarkable or dangerous in most contexts: at 3 speed they are far slower than player characters and other snakes, and though they can immobilize a character, their attacks do not deal significant damage. However, their holding attack can drown characters near water, making them a source of YASD for the unsuspecting. Unlike giant eels and other sea monsters with drowning attacks, pythons are not found near water any more frequently than other monsters, making it easy to forget - pythons also use a different message for their holding attack than other drowning monsters.

Be especially wary of pythons while crossing the waters of Medusa's Island - setting a MSGTYPE rule for the python's message in your options can be a helpful reminder. Greased armor or an oilskin cloak can also protect from their holding attacks.

History

The python first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Pythonidae
Wikipedia has an article about:
Python (genus)

Pythonidae, commonly known as pythons, are a family of nonvenomous snakes found in Africa, Asia, and Australia that contains some of the largest snakes in the world - ten genera and 39 species are currently recognized, including the genus Python (or "true pythons"). Pythons are non-venomous snakes that hunt via ambush predation and constrict their prey to suffocate it prior to consumption: they will typically strike at and bite their prey of choice to gain hold of it, then use their physical strength to coil their muscular bodies around the prey animal, effectively suffocating it and causing cardiac arrest before swallowing it whole. Collectively, the pythons are among the most well-documented-and-studied constrictor snakes, much like other non-venomous snakes such as the boas.

Pythons are oviparous, laying eggs that females incubate until they hatch. While many species are available in the exotic pet trade, caution is needed with larger species due to potential danger. Pythons are poached for their meat and skin, leading to a billion-dollar global trade, and can also carry diseases such as salmonella. They are used in African traditional medicine to treat ailments like rheumatism and mental illnesses, and their body parts, including blood and organs, are believed to have various healing properties. In some African cultures, pythons have significant roles in folklore and mythology, often symbolizing strength or a sacred status.

Message

<The python> grabs you!
A python hit you with its holding attack; their first holding attack can drown you.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, pythons hit as +1 weapons.

Pythons can be generated in real zoos, and will not randomly generate in Gehennom. The Snake Pit of the Lawful Quest may contain pythons among the random 2-4 S generated at level creation.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, 1⁄5 of the monsters randomly generated on the Water Temple level of the Chaos Temple Quest will be pythons.

Four pythons appear within one of the rooms in Demogorgon's lair containing the statue trap of Shaktari if his dwelling appears as the third Abyss level.

Encyclopedia entry

See the encyclopedia entry for snake.

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1243: snakes get a free house

A '''python''', {{monsym|python}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a type of non-[[poison]]ous [[Snake (monster class)|snake]] that has [[infravision]], and it can [[swim]] like other snakes, but will not [[hide]] under objects.

A python has a bite attack, a touch attack, a [[holding attack]] that doubles as a [[drowning attack]], and a second holding attack.

==Generation==
Randomly generated pythons are always created hostile.

Pythons generate among the random {{white|S}} that are part of the first quest [[monster class]] for [[Archeologist]]s and make up {{frac|24|35}} of the monsters that randomly generate on the [[Archeologist quest]].

Pythons generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under, despite lacking the ability to hide.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1243|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=snakes get a free house}}

==Strategy==
Pythons are rarely remarkable or dangerous in most contexts: at 3 [[speed]] they are far slower than player characters and other snakes, and though they can immobilize a character, their attacks do not deal significant damage. However, their holding attack can drown characters near water, making them a source of [[YASD]] for the unsuspecting. Unlike [[giant eels]] and other [[sea monster]]s with drowning attacks, pythons are not found near water any more frequently than other monsters, making it easy to forget - pythons also use a different message for their holding attack than other drowning monsters.

Be especially wary of pythons while crossing the waters of Medusa's Island - setting a [[MSGTYPE]] rule for the python's message in your options can be a helpful reminder. [[Greased]] armor or an [[oilskin cloak]] can also protect from their holding attacks.

==History==
The python first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Pythonidae}}
{{wikipedia|Python (genus)}}
''Pythonidae'', commonly known as pythons, are a family of nonvenomous snakes found in Africa, Asia, and Australia that contains some of the largest snakes in the world - ten genera and 39 species are currently recognized, including the genus ''Python'' (or "true pythons"). Pythons are non-venomous snakes that hunt via ambush predation and constrict their prey to suffocate it prior to consumption: they will typically strike at and bite their prey of choice to gain hold of it, then use their physical strength to coil their muscular bodies around the prey animal, effectively suffocating it and causing cardiac arrest before swallowing it whole. Collectively, the pythons are among the most well-documented-and-studied constrictor snakes, much like other non-venomous snakes such as the boas.

Pythons are oviparous, laying eggs that females incubate until they hatch. While many species are available in the exotic pet trade, caution is needed with larger species due to potential danger. Pythons are poached for their meat and skin, leading to a billion-dollar global trade, and can also carry diseases such as salmonella. They are used in African traditional medicine to treat ailments like rheumatism and mental illnesses, and their body parts, including blood and organs, are believed to have various healing properties. In some African cultures, pythons have significant roles in folklore and mythology, often symbolizing strength or a sacred status.

==Message==
{{message|<The python> grabs you!|A python hit you with its holding attack; their first holding attack can drown you.}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In SLASH'EM, pythons [[Hits creatures as +x weapon|hit as +1 weapons]].

Pythons can be generated in [[real zoo]]s, and will not randomly generate in [[Gehennom]]. The Snake Pit of the [[Lawful Quest]] may contain pythons among the random 2-4 {{white|S}} generated at level creation.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], {{frac|5}} of the monsters randomly generated on the Water Temple level of the [[Chaos Temple Quest]] will be pythons.

Four pythons appear within one of the rooms in [[Demogorgon]]'s lair containing the [[statue trap]] of [[Shaktari]] if his dwelling appears as [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine Flats#Demogorgon's palace|the third Abyss level]].
